node.title: Janice fears border reopening may see her rental chances disappear
node.alt: A woman with blonde hair stands on a front doorstep
node.description: Experts are calling for more regulation of the short-stay industry, with fears Tasmania's border reopening could make the rental crisis even worse.
node.content:
["Janice Humphreys knows all too well how difficult it is to find a rental in Tasmania at the moment.", "Her rental in Westbury is about to be sold, and she needs to find a place by January.", "\"This is the first time I've actually felt I might not have anywhere to go,\" she said.", "\"A lot of rental inspections are cancelled before the viewing, and when you do get to go to one, there's 20 or 30 people and it's just gone nowhere.\"", "Vacancy rates across Tasmania are extremely low \u2014\u00a0just 0.4 per cent in Hobart, 0.2 in Burnie and 0.7 in Launceston \u2014\u00a0and more than 4,000 Tasmanians are on the social housing waitlist.", "Experts are worried that will get even worse when Tasmania's borders re-open, if more homes are put on the short-stay accommodation market.", "
Hosts excited, experts concerned
", "", "
Genia McGirr's room\u00a0is booked out\u00a0for several weeks.(ABC News: Simon Farrell)
", "Genia McGirr rents out a room in her Hobart home through Airbnb, and is looking forward to welcoming back visitors.\u00a0", "\"I'm quite heavily booked out right up until the middle of January \u2014\u00a0it's all up and ready to go,\" she said.\u00a0", "She started hosting visitors after a marriage breakup a few years ago.\u00a0", "\"I have just grown so much physically; mentally too it's been just fabulous that I'm such a busy person and looking after my guests,\" she said.\u00a0", "While Ms McGirr shares\u00a0her home, experts are worried about those renting out entire properties to the tourist market.\u00a0", "Hobart has one of the highest densities of short-stay accommodation,\u00a0\u00a0such as Airbnb,\u00a0in the world.", "The city is also the least affordable capital city\u00a0in Australia for renters, and affordability is declining in regional Tasmania too.", "Prior to the pandemic, housing expert Professor Peter Phibbs found that in some Hobart suburbs, one in 10 properties were in the short-term rental market.", "\"Even though things aren't as intense as in central Hobart, we're also seeing the spread right across the state,\" he said.", "As a result of the pandemic, Tasmania's short stay industry has decreased by about 15 per cent, with some homes put back on the long-term rental market.", "
Rental hike prediction
", "Professor Phibbs, from the University of Sydney,\u00a0said if those homes were\u00a0turned back into short stays when Tasmania's border re-opens this week, it could have a dramatic effect on Tasmanian renters.", "\"If that happens we will see vacancy rates decrease and rents increase,\" he said.", "\"Just looking at the returns for both short and long-term renters, it's quite an attractive option to move to the short-term market.\"", "Tasmanian Tenants Union's Ben Bartl said renters were\u00a0being asked to leave caravan parks to make way for tourists.", "\"We are extremely worried with borders re-opening the rental market is going to get worse,\" he said.", "
Fresh call\u00a0for more regulation
", "The City of Hobart has called for more regulation of the short stay industry in the past, and Labor too wants to see a pause in new permits for short stays.", "Professor Phibbs also believes there needs to be some regulation.", "\"I think we can't have a functional long-term rental market and a deregulated short-term,\" he said.", "\"I\u00a0think we need some balance between the markets.\"", "But Housing Minister\u00a0Michael Ferguson said short-stay accommodation was not responsible for the rental crisis.", "\"Banning or limiting short-stay accommodation will not resolve the current shortage of affordable rental accommodation, particularly in our urban centres,\" he said.", "
Mostly 'mum and dad hosts'
", "In a statement, Airbnb's head of public policy for Australia and New Zealand Derek Nolan rejected claims entire homes being rented out to tourists was\u00a0contributing to Tasmania's rental unaffordability.", "\"Many hosts on Airbnb share their own home to help combat rising costs of living and meet mortgage repayments,\" he said.", "\"In turn, these hosts help drive economic growth and job creation, with many local businesses relying on the valuable tourism dollars spent by Airbnb guests.", "\"Airbnb is Tasmania's largest accommodation provider and the overwhelming majority of our hosts are 'mum and dad' operators looking to supplement their income, with many hit hard by the pandemic.\"", "", "
